action.action-desc: Mr. Upton (for himself, Mr. Markey, Mr. Tauzin, Mr. Dingell, Mr. Bilirakis, Mr. Barton of Texas, Mr. Stearns, Mr. Gillmor, Mr. Bass, Mr. Greenwood, Mr. Burr, Mr. Blunt, Mr. Shimkus, Mr. Terry, Mr. Weldon of Pennsylvania, Mr. Wolf, Mr. Smith of Texas, Mr. Green of Texas, Mrs. Wilson of New Mexico, Mr. Gordon, Mr. Whitfield, Mrs. Bono, Ms. McCarthy of Missouri, Mr. Wynn, Mrs. Cubin, and Mr. Pitts) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce

form.official-title: To increase the penalties for violations by television and radio broadcasters of the prohibitions against transmission of obscene, indecent, and profane language.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the &short-title1; of 2004.

section.header: Increase in penalties for obscene, indecent, and profane broadcasts
section.text: Section 503(b)(2) of the Communications Act of 1934 (47 U.S.C. 503(b)(2)) is amendedâ€”

paragraph.text: by redesignating subparagraphs (C) and (D) as subparagraphs (D) and (E), respectively;
by inserting after subparagraph (B) the following new subparagraph:

subparagraph.text: Notwithstanding subparagraph (A), if the violator is (i) a broadcast station licensee or permittee, or (ii) an applicant for any broadcast license, permit, certificate, or other instrument or authorization issued by the Commission, and the violator is determined by the Commission under paragraph (1) to have broadcast obscene, indecent, or profane language, the amount of any forfeiture penalty determined under this section shall not exceed $275,000 for each violation or each day of a continuing violation, except that the amount assessed for any continuing violation shall not exceed a total of $3,000,000 for any single act or failure to act.

paragraph.text: in subparagraph (D), as redesignated by paragraph (1), by striking subparagraph (A) or (B) and inserting subparagraph (A), (B), or (C).
